story:
Selamat malam, little one!

Once upon a time, in a small village nestled in the lush green hills of Indonesia, there was a magical world hidden deep within the heart of a mighty betel nut tree. The tree was called "Nagagini", which means "the queen of the night" in our traditional Javanese language.

In this world, there lived a kind and gentle princess named Lusi. She was the daughter of King Suro and Queen Murti, who ruled over the Nagagini kingdom. Lusi was loved by all the creatures of the forest, from the smallest insect to the largest tree spirits. She had a special gift â€“ she could communicate with all living beings through the language of flowers.

Every night, Lusi would wander through the forest, using her gift to listen to the whispers of the trees, the songs of the birds, and the rustling of the leaves. She would learn about the secrets of the forest and the hidden wonders that lay beneath the surface.

One night, as Lusi was exploring a hidden glade, she stumbled upon a sparkling fairy named Lita. Lita was trapped in a small glass jar, surrounded by a halo of soft, shimmering light. Lusi knew that she had to release Lita, and with a gentle touch, the fairy was free.

Grateful for her kindness, Lita gifted Lusi with a magical flower that would bloom only once a year, under the light of the full moon. The flower, known as the "Bunga Malam", had the power to bring dreams to children, filling their hearts with sweet memories and guiding them through the night.

As the years passed, Lusi's kingdom flourished, and the magical world of Nagagini became a place of wonder and enchantment. Children from far and wide would come to visit Lusi, seeking her wisdom and the secrets of the forest. And every year, on the night of the full moon, the Bunga Malam would bloom, filling the air with sweet scent and the whispers of whispered secrets.

As you drift off to sleep, little one, remember that the magical world of Nagagini is always here, woven into the threads of your dreams. May the Bunga Malam bloom in your heart, guiding you through the night and filling your heart with sweet memories of wonder and enchantment. Selamat malam, sweet dreams, and may your heart remain filled with magic!
